clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Evaluating a Total Disc Replacement in Patients With Cervical Disc Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Study Evaluating the Performance of the CerPass® Total Disc Replacement in Patients With Single-Level Cervical Disc Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study will be a non-randomized trial consisting of patients with single level (C3 to C7) symptomatic cervical disc disease who have not previously received fusion surgery at the same level, and have failed to improve with conservative treatment for at least 6 weeks prior to enrollment, or who present with progressive neurological symptoms or signs in the face of conservative treatment.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Marketing of CE marked device has been discontinued.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoints will be individual patient success at 24 months.

secondary_outcome.description: Range of Motion (ROM) defined as more than 3 degrees total flexion / extension. If the ROM is less than or equal to 3º the patient will be defined as having "non-motion."
SF-36 improvement of 15% at 24 months compared to Baseline
Visual analog pain scale (VAS) improvement of 20 mm at 24 months compared to Baseline
Disc height from the lateral radiograph showing maintenance or improvement from baseline at 24 months.

study_pop.textblock: Volunteers will be selected from the surgeon's existing clinic patients.
